On December 1, 2017, he released his third studio album (No. 1 on the US Billboard 200) titled “No. 6 Collaborations Project”. His most recent studio album, “(2019) = (Divide)”, features collaborations with artists including Billie Eilish, Lil Nas X, and Khalid, and was released on December 13, 2017.

Romford.passage:
- Romford
Romford (pronunciation (listen), Romford) is a town in the London Borough of Havering. It is the capital of the East London Borough of Havering and lies about 19 miles (30 km) east of the Royal Observatory in Greenwich. According to The British Gazette, Havering was a place "in the middle of nowhere which existed only because there were too many people in the rest of the borough. Its name has always been a source of controversy. To avoid confusion, in the latter part of the 19th century it was given the name 'Romford' by the Royal Commission for London. They changed the name of the nearby town (which was called Romford before) to Havering, and the rest of the borough took its name from this. Romford is a large town located in the East of England. In the 2001 Census the population of the town was 75,000, while the population of the London Borough of Havering was 88,000. In the town, there are a number of old listed buildings, such as the Romford Minster and the old railway station. Romford has also been known for its association with the American GIs of World War II. The town is served by the London Overground (TfL Rail) rail network.

The commission was also responsible for the construction of a new railway station and the extension of the London Overground line.

the La Mesa Junior High School.term: the La Mesa Junior High School
the La Mesa Junior High School.passage:
According to the 1957 San Diego Union newspaper, "La Mesa Junior High School for grades 7-8 was established in 1950-1951 when San Diego City Schools relocated La Mesa Junior High School to a new building after 34 years of operation at La Mesa Junior High School." The new building was located in a new school district called "Poway Unified School District." In addition, there was "also a new swimming pool at La Mesa Junior High School." The new school district is the La Mesa-Foothills Unified School District. There's some other interesting information from the Wikipedia page:
"In the 1960s, the school district was divided into two different school districts: the East and West Coast school district. When the two districts merged, La Mesa became the name for the new school district. La Mesa Junior High School was renamed La Mesa Junior High School and became a member of the La Mesa-Foothills Unified School District." That's pretty interesting. It's like the school has "evolved" or something. Here are a couple of more pics I've found:
A look at the new La Mesa Jr. High school, a few months after completion. It was built in the middle of 1954. (from my sources)
I'm guessing this is probably an older "high school" style picture of La Mesa Jr. High School.

I was born in a small town, and had very few opportunities to hear this music and to become immersed in it. The musical aspect of jazz and jazz-fusion was the only musical style I ever really heard and was interested in. The fact that some of the jazz I listened to has a strong gospel aspect to it made me want to go to church more frequently.
